newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends firmer and at top of range.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends firmer and at top of range.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures closed sharply higher, with the spot-May contract ending on the key psychological 11.00-cent mark amid speculative and local buying, dealers said.

A dearth of selling allowed May to climb to 10.97 cents early, where it lingered for most of the day. Trade scale-up selling kept a lid on the rally, but aggressive buying on the close pushed the spot month over its upside target of 11.00.
Many trading sources viewed the close at the top of the day's range as a bullish indicator and said May could rack up further gains on Wednesday.
Refco analyst Anne Prendergast stressed that the market failed to break out of its range, however, adding that prices are more likely to retrace gains.
"The specs and locals bought it up because it's not going down," Prendergast said. "I don't see the justification for the upside move given tepid physical offtake and no compelling bullish news."
Firm resistance was pegged at 11.15 cents and support around the day's low of 10.78 cents basis the May contract.
The spot month settled 0.15 cent higher to 10.94 cents, having ranged from 11.01 to 10.78 cents. The back months ended 0.13 to 0.06 firmer.
Volume was estimated at 17,686 lots compared with Monday's official 6,366 lots.
Open interest in May fell 176 lots to 58,478 lots, as of Monday's close. Dealers said players have begun to roll May positions into July.
The last trading day for the May contract is April 30.
